link.synopsis: In this big-screen adaptation of the beloved Frank O. King comic strip, half-brothers Corky (Scotty Beckett) and Skeezix (Jimmy Lydon) end up running a restaurant where family disagreements seem to be the main course. Next, Joe Sawyer and William Tracy star in a service-comedy double feature, in which Tracy reprises his famed role of Sgt. Dorian "Dodo" Doubleday, a soldier with a photographic memory.

link.synopsis: Manu wants his mother to come to the United States and live with his family, but they both know his bossy wife, Lily, would never allow it. Then, Manu's mother devises an ingenious plan: She'll disguise herself as a maid and work at her son's house. Unfortunately, Lily is none too fond of the family's new addition. Directed by Manoj Shah, this comedy-drama stars Kalpana Diwan, Rajul Diwan, Sachi Joshi, Niyati Joshi, Karan Mehta and Jyotika Shah.
link.title: synopsis
Som Thi Shukra Taro, Shaniware Hun Maro
Pachhi Kehta Nahi Ke Kahyun Nahotu

link.synopsis: The seasoned vaudeville expertise of funnyman Ed Wynn is on full display in these four episodes from the performer's Emmy-winning TV series from 1949 and 1950, featuring top Hollywood talent of the day. In this collection, Wynn welcomes to the show special guests Oscar-winning actress Celeste Holm (Gentlemen's Agreement), Hollywood's "Oomph Girl" Ann Sheridan, Bride of Frankenstein star Elsa Lanchester and silent-comedy pioneer Buster Keaton.
link.title: synopsis
Shemp Cocktail: A Toast to the Original Stooge

link.synopsis: A shy student (Jason Dolley) loses his inhibitions and finds newfound freedom -- inside a chicken mascot suit -- while a neglected teen girl (Emily Osment) channels her inner superspy to rescue her famous dad in this pair of family-friendly comedies from Disney. It's all about tapping into your alter ego with this wacky double bill that co-stars Disney Channel favorites Mitchel Musso, Jason Earles, Tiffany Thornton, David Henrie and Moises Arias.
link.title: synopsis
Wizards on Deck with Hannah Montana
The Suite Life on Deck: Anchors Away!

link.synopsis: There's no harm in dreaming big, but heading to America to become the next hot boy band when you're pushing 40 and not exactly movie-star handsome? That's just madness -- or so everyone thinks when the Berlin Brothers set off on their quest. Against all odds, however, they do succeed ... but at what price? That's the central question in this road film/comedy from Marcus Mittermeier and Jan Henrik Stahlberg (who also co-star).
link.title: synopsis
Vision: From the Life of Hildegard von Bingen
Our Hitler: A Film from Germany
Schoolgirl Report: Vol. 5: What All Parents Should Know
My Song Goes Round the World

link.synopsis: When beauty queen Natalia (Marjorie De Sousa) moves to Miami in the hopes of launching a modeling career, she finds an ally in fashion executive Esteban (Víctor González) -- and a rival in Esteban's ex, a jealous supermodel named Vanessa (Evelyn Santos) -- in this telenovela-style comedy-drama. As she navigates the rocky runway to fame, Natalia encounters cutthroat competition, less-than-glamorous gigs … and a little romance.
link.title: synopsis
The Doctor Takes a Wife / A Night to Remember
Death Note: L: Change the WorLd

link.synopsis: When strip club owner Joe (Carmine Capobianco) and manicure artist Kate (Debi Thibeault) discover they have a mutual interest in slicing and dicing hapless victims, it's love at first site, and soon the pair are off on a happy killing spree. But when one victim's parts clog up their garbage disposal, they call in a plumber, who blackmails the lovebirds into providing him with fresh bodies to cannibalize. Gorman Bechard directs this horror-comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Don't Answer the Phone / Prime Evil

link.synopsis: The lives of two men intersect in this comedy-drama from writer-director Darko Lungulov. Serbian immigrant Branko (Branislav Trifunovic) wants his girlfriend, Ivana (Jelena Mrdja), to come live in America, while struggling New York musician Robert (David Thornton) desperately needs money. Robert agrees to travel to Belgrade to marry Ivana, but during the course of his chaotic trip, he encounters plenty of surprises. Pop icon Cyndi Lauper co-stars.
link.title: synopsis
How to Make Love to a Woman
It's Kind of a Funny Story

link.synopsis: Perennial wallflower Henry (Sverrir Gudnason) hopes to spice up his life by moving to Spain and opening a restaurant with a friend (David Dencik). But just as he's about to leave, things begin to get interesting -- thanks, in part, to a punked-out feminist stripper named Marie (Tuva Novotny). A stash of steroids, a mentally ill mother and an excursion to IKEA round out this quirky comedy-drama from filmmakers Alexander Brøndsted and Antonio Tublén.
link.title: synopsis
Pusher 2: With Blood on My Hands
Pusher 3: I'm the Angel of Death

The Girl Who Played with Fire

link.synopsis: Nick Frost, Ben Crompton, Amanda Abbington, Nicholas Burns and other talented cast members deliver plenty of laughs in this British sketch-comedy show that's chock full of inappropriate behavior, awkward situations and brutally honest confessions. This second season features a married couple's ill-fated role-playing adventures, an office manager's misguided attempts to soothe her staff and a terminally ill girl's outlandish last wish.

People Like Us: The Complete Series

link.synopsis: Chris Lemmon narrates this intimate biographical portrait of his father, two-time Oscar-winning actor Jack Lemmon, that features revealing interviews with Lemmon's closest friends and colleagues as well as rarely seen personal photographs. The documentary was originally released as part of The Jack Lemmon Film Collection, which presents five of Lemmon's best-loved Columbia Pictures comedies.

link.synopsis: Discover how six seemingly ordinary but supremely talented men became Monty Python, sketch comedy's inspired group of lunatics who turned such unlikely sources of inspiration as Spam, dead parrots and the Inquisition into enduring punch lines. This entertaining documentary includes interviews with members of the troupe, as well as home movies, photos and rare recordings from Monty Python's early years.

link.synopsis: Helmed by directors Alexander Hall and Richard Wallace, this pair of charming screwball comedies stars silver-screen beauty Loretta Young, alongside Ray Milland, Brian Aherne and Sidney Toler. In the first, a feminist author (Young) and a sexist MD (Milland) pose as husband and wife to improve their public personas. In the second, a mystery writer (Aherne) moves into a shady apartment in search of inspiration and gets more than he bargained for.

link.synopsis: Just as he's preparing to make a long-term commitment to his girlfriend, idealistic Flemish journalist Tom (Pepijn Caudron) falls for beautiful Pakistani immigrant Nadia (Sana Mouziane), who shakes up his cherished beliefs about love and politics. Tom's once orderly world is further eroded when his cantankerous grandfather (Jaak Van Assche) expresses his wish to be euthanized. Jan Verheyen directs this comedy-drama.
link.title: synopsis
How Much Do You Love Me?
Uncle Boonmee Who Can Recall His Past Lives
When Did You Last See Your Father?
The Private Lives of Pippa Lee

link.synopsis: Longing to get away, two alienated teens (Cristi Petrescu and Iulia Verdes) hide out in an abandoned factory on the edge of town. But their quest for respite takes a dark turn when they find themselves trapped in a tiny cargo elevator with little hope of escape. The Romanian New Wave rolls on with this gritty, deftly acted comedy-drama from George Dorobantu, who shot the film on a budget of 200 euros.
link.title: synopsis
A Long Weekend in Pest and Buda

link.synopsis: Work and romance clash in these two classic comedies. In Rich Relations, secretary Nancy Tilton (Frances Grant) enjoys the attentions of the office Romeo (Barry Norton), but doesn't realize her boss (Ralph Forbes) is smitten with her. Then, in Hats Off, two rival publicists (John Payne and Mae Clarke) fall for each other. But problems ensue because they're each in charge of battling international expositions -- and each is determined to win.
link.title: synopsis
SCTV: Best of the Early Years
Has Anybody Seen My Gal? / A Very Special Favor

Caught in the Draft / Give Me a Sailor: Double Feature
Here Comes Cookie / Love in Bloom / Six of a Kind: Triple Feature

My Favorite Blonde / Star Spangled Rhythm

link.synopsis: In the Moroccan beach town of Tangier, young fish-selling entrepreneur Driss (Ouassini Embarek) strikes up an unlikely friendship with crotchety café owner Fouad (Jacques Nolot), who accepts Driss's proposal to help fix up the café in exchange for making Driss a business partner. But a fog of rumors and deception soon befalls Driss's grand plans in this intimate comedy-drama based on a short story by Paul Bowles.
link.title: synopsis
In the Arms of My Enemy

link.synopsis: When the dastardly Count Contini (Nigel Green) masterminds a scheme to hijack an economy-wrecking sum of $1 billion in gold, suave secret agent Matt Helm (Dean Martin) reluctantly teams with clumsy Scandinavian spy Freya Carlson (Sharon Tate) to thwart the plan. Dino is as smooth as ever in the spy-comedy franchise's fourth and final film, which features future star Chuck Norris in a small role.
link.title: synopsis
Dr. Goldfoot and the Girl Bombs
The Man with One Red Shoe
Get Smart's Bruce & Lloyd Out of Control

link.synopsis: Follow the animated adventures of Mr. Tickle as he roams through the borough of Dillydale, hoping to brighten the day of his fellow Mr. Men and Little Misses -- especially dour Mr. Grumpy -- by giving them a fun tickle just when they need it most. This collection features six music- and comedy-filled episodes from the Emmy-nominated cartoon based on the beloved children's books by Roger Hargreaves.

link.synopsis: Hired by staunchly homophobic Jin-Hyuk (Ji-hun Ju) to work in his newly opened Antique Bakery, flamboyantly gay pastry chef Sun-Woo (Kim Jae-Wook) turns the patisserie into a colorful wonderland of delightful delicacies and tantalizing treats. But when the bakery is tied to a rash of grim murders, the unlikely pair must get to the bottom of the crime spree. Kyu-Dong Min directs this delectable comedy-drama confection.
link.title: synopsis
I Really, Really Like You: Vol. 2
The Legend of the Shadowless Sword

link.synopsis: When a man in their Edinburgh boarding house dies, poor Irish immigrants Burke (Derren Nesbitt) and Hare (Glynn Edwards) discover they can make good money by supplying corpses for scientific study to a doctor at the university medical school. Inconvenienced by the lack of available cadavers, the cunning pair soon turn to murder to maintain their revenue stream. Vernon Sewell directs this classic comedy-horror romp that co-stars Harry Andrews.
link.title: synopsis
Val Lewton: I Walked with a Zombie / The Body Snatcher
Terror Tales: Dr. Vampire / Death Kiss
Crypt of Terror: Land of the Minotaur / Terror
Dead Eyes of London / The Ghost

The Incredible Two Headed Transplant / The Thing with Two Heads
The Gore Gore Girls: Special Edition

link.synopsis: When a celebrated Chinese opera troupe loses its sponsorship funding, the laid-off performers must seek out temporary jobs in a wide spectrum of fields. But all along, they yearn to reunite their company and perform again. Featuring a colorful ensemble of mostly nonprofessional actors, the warm comedy-drama was nominated in four categories -- including Best Film and Best Screenplay  --  at mainland China's prestigious Golden Rooster Awards in 2007.
link.title: synopsis
A Woman, a Gun and a Noodle Shop
If You Are the One: Love and Marriage
My Wife Is a Gambling Maestro
Love Is a Many Stupid Thing

link.synopsis: The hellions at St Trinian's School for Girls are up to their usual shenanigans as they blackmail a diamond thief, forcing him to pose as headmistress to "chaperone" them on a Continental romp to meet a marriage-minded Italian prince. Featuring beloved British thespians Alastair Sim, Terry-Thomas and Lionel Jeffries, the film is the second in a series of four outrageous comedies that follow the antics of St. Trinian's young mischief makers.
link.title: synopsis
The Pure Hell of St. Trinian's
Love and Pain and the Whole Damn Thing
A Hard Day's Night: Collector's Series

link.synopsis: The Trinity Boys, Plata (Terence Hill) and Salud (Bud Spencer), are hired to ditch a plane in the South American Amazon jungle so the owner can collect the insurance. But when the plane really crashes, the boys find themselves fighting for survival. This old-school buddy action-comedy follows the Trinity Boys as they fight once more for the underdogs: a group of unfortunate emerald miners who have few rights.
link.title: synopsis
Tedeum / Revenge of Trinty / Viva Django / Blackie the Pirate

link.synopsis: In this romantic comedy-drama from Filipina director Cathy Garcia-Molina, Laida (Sarah Geronimo) and Miggy (John Lloyd Cruz) think they've found perfect happiness with each other, until circumstances beyond their control threaten to pull them apart. As their burgeoning careers begin to take them in entirely different directions -- Miggy to Laguna, Laida to Canada -- they struggle to keep their relationship alive across a great distance.
link.title: synopsis
All About Love: Ang Sarap Ma-In Love

link.synopsis: This innovative anthology features an eclectic mix of shorts, award-winning documentaries and other films, including three comedies from director Spike Jonze and a fascinating look at a beauty pageant held inside a women's prison in Colombia. Other highlights include a glimpse into real-life Mormon polygamy and acting lessons for faking sexual ecstasy. Watch for appearances by Eric Stoltz, Catherine Keener, Carla Gugino and other Hollywood stars.
link.title: synopsis
Errol Morris' First Person: The Complete Series
People Who Die Mysteriously in Their Sleep
Peach / A Bitter Song / Lavender Limelight
The Ballad of Jack and Rose

link.synopsis: When Rocky's friends decide to throw a love-smitten husband-to-be a wild bachelor party, they pull out all the stops -- and when the prostitutes show up, the craziness is only just beginning in this zany story. A nod to the 1980s Tom Hanks slob-comedy classic, this bawdy Indian sex farce proves once and for all that America has not cornered the market on this kind of outrageous, over-the-top and hilariously tasteless humor.
link.title: synopsis
Rocket Singh: Salesman of the Year

link.synopsis: Silent-film starlet Constance Talmadge plays her trademark "virtuous vamp" in this pair of classic comedies that reveal her gift for lighthearted fare: Her Night of Romance (1924) and Her Sister from Paris (1925). In Her Night of Romance, Talmadge plays an heiress in disguise who falls for a once-wealthy nobleman (Ronald Colman). Then, in Her Sister from Paris, she pulls double duty as a down-in-the-dumps housewife and her vivacious twin sister.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Actor and stand-up comedian Bob Golub crafts a unique "docu-comedy" based on his own life growing up in a large family in working-class Pittsburgh, where his domineering father, Dodo, rationed affection but never turned down a drink. The film blends actual footage of the family with Golub's own impressions of his father and brothers, resulting in a highly personal take on parent-child dysfunction.

link.synopsis: Beloved by movie fans the world over for decades, brainy sleuth Sherlock Holmes has been brought to the screen by a gallery of directors and stars, and in treatments that range from the reverential to the comic. The titles assembled in this archival collection include "The Sting of Death," an episode from a TV anthology series, featuring Boris Karloff; "The Man Who Disappeared," the pilot from an unaired British TV series; and two short comedies.

link.synopsis: This Web-based action-comedy-suspense series follows the adventures of Neal Bannen (Mark Gantt), a happy-go-lucky con man who tries to quit his life of crime but quickly finds himself indebted to a mobster who orders him to pull off one final job. Now tasked with stealing a mysterious box, Bannen gets caught between cops, rival gangsters and a trio of ultrasexy female assassins. Michael Ironside, Robert Forster and Vanessa Marcil co-star.

American Bandits: Frank and Jesse James
My Own Worst Enemy: The Complete Series

link.synopsis: This NBC comedy's premiere season introduces three unique young couples -- Vance (David Walton) and Amy (Mary Elizabeth Ellis), Rex (Hayes MacArthur) and Leigh (Olivia Munn), and Dave (Kyle Bornheimer) and Julia (Christine Woods) -- each trying their best to achieve their vision of the idyllic relationship. But there are obstacles on the road to bliss: too much outside advice, too much everyday banality and sometimes a little too much passion.

link.synopsis: Ray (Bob McGrath) is paid to woo lawyers from their firms, and new Colombian wife Teresa (Isabel Robayo) works as a phone-sex operator, but their own language barrier has them barely speaking. Then Ray's square-peg sister, Linda (Elizabeth Schofield), pays a visit, breaking the silence in novel ways. In this indie comedy-drama set in New York City, Linda falls in with an addict, Teresa's eye wanders and Ray copes with failing health and home.
link.title: synopsis
I Love You, Don't Touch Me

link.synopsis: This biting comedy-drama set in post-World War II England revolves around four people whose lives change forever when they win big in the local football pool. In the first story, a suburban family is split by quarrels over their anticipated luxuries. Other threads follow a clerk who tries to stand up to his wife, a singer who persuades her boyfriend to forge a winning ticket, and a disgruntled musician who seeks revenge on an obnoxious conductor.

The Ealing Comedy Collection: Whisky Galore

link.synopsis: This sketch-comedy series from Stephen Fry and Hugh Laurie finds the multitalented British humorists pushing the envelope of funny in episodes brimming with inspired sketches, outlandish characters and other mayhem. Especially acclaimed for their style of humor based on intricate and highly suggestive wordplay, Fry and Laurie also bring to life memorable characters, including ultra-polite secret agents Control and Tony.

link.synopsis: When three married men decide to step out on their marriages they get more than they bargained for. As each settle into lustful and emotional affairs with their mistresses, they find that infidelity has unpredictable and devastating consequences. Betrayal, hypocrisy, racism and several other matters surface as married men and single women come together. This comedy-drama stars James Winningham Jr. and Michael Wayne Thomas.

link.synopsis: This horror-comedy hybrid follows the misguided efforts of Dr. Gino Conti, a genetic engineer who tries to manufacture a son for himself by splicing together human and reptile DNA -- only to create a people-eating monstrosity he never bargained for.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: In this darkly funny comedy-drama, a group of college friends reunite for a Christmas celebration that goes horribly wrong. As their friendships unravel, they find out that their lives didn't turn out exactly as they'd hoped.
link.title: synopsis
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog

Return of the Living Dead 4: Necropolis

link.synopsis: This slice-of-life comedy-drama set in Delhi follows six young men from different regions and backgrounds who come together to share a mess of an apartment they lovingly call "Sadda Adda."
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: In the year 2010, the Empire of Britannia uses robotic Knightmare Frames to invade Area 11 (formerly known as Japan). Meanwhile, Lelouch -- a Britannian high schooler living in Area 11 -- stumbles into the heart of the local resistance. Taking the side of the rebels, he receives the power of Geass, which ensures that any order he commands will be obeyed. The revolution is on in this stirring anime series from director Goro Taniguchi.

link.synopsis: ABC "Nightline" correspondent Robert Krulwich lends a lighthearted touch to genetic science in this provocative two-hour "Nova" special that takes you inside the amazing, complex and contentious race to decode the human genome. Now armed with the genetic code, medical pioneers are making astonishing breakthroughs that will change medicine as we know it. Could these discoveries eventually lead to cures for diseases such as cancer and Alzheimer's?

On the way, the former adversaries realize they've been double-crossed by their own governments and that the CIA and KGB have secretly joined forces and plan to sacrifice them to cover up both agencies' transgressions. The two must team up if they hope to win this intricate and deadly game.

link.synopsis: Ecuadorian musician Segundo Rosero's hit "Como Voy a Olvidarte" ("How Can I Forget You?") is the inspiration for this entertaining look at one of life's greatest goals: The journey to true happiness. But, as always, the road is pockmarked with troubles and toil, complicated further by a person's ability to thwart himself even under the best of circumstances. Stars Rafael Rivelles, Ana Cristina Botero, Segundo Rosero and Daniel Moreno.

1888: El Extraordinario Viaje de la Santa Isabel

link.synopsis: Although they've represented the Universidad Nacional Autónoma de México for more than 40 years, the Pumas have fans in just about every corner of Mexico and are known for supplying the country's national soccer team with some of its best new players. This Spanish-language documentary relives some of the Pumas' most memorable moments, including highlights from the careers of notable players such as Enrique Borja and Hugo Sanchez.

link.synopsis: After dishonestly working his way up through the ranks, a Mexican police officer has earned a spot as a key adviser to a presidential candidate. But his relationship with a sexy woman could jeopardize everything. Now, ruled by his passion for her able charms, he's merely a pawn in her political scheme. Alejandro Camacho, Adriana Fonseca, Manuel Landeta, Carlos Cardan and Florencia Farret co-star in this sizzling drama from Christian Gonzalez.

link.synopsis: Successful motivational speaker and theology expert Gillen Lane (Casper Van Dien) comes to regret his decision to join forces with Stone Alexander (Michael York), a charismatic media mogul hiding sinister plans behind a façade of benevolence. After enlisting Lane's aid in creating a one-world government, Alexander installs himself as leader and begins to carry out his apocalyptic scheme: All he needs is to crack a secret code within the Torah.

link.synopsis: FBI Agent Jason Chandler (Patrick Muldoon) gets more than he bargained for when he probes a string of homicides committed against … serial murderers. He discovers a pattern among the executions while tracking a psychotic killer (C. Thomas Howell) and begins to suspect the Red Team -- Chandler's elite FBI unit -- of the vigilante killings. Unable to trust anyone, he turns to his retired mentor (Fred Ward) for help in this direct-to-video thriller.

link.synopsis: When both the CIA and the underworld mistake regular guy Stuart Dempsey (Danny Nucci) for a notorious killer-for-hire named Jaguar, Dempsey doesn't know whom he can turn to or trust. Certain only of his boss, Max Kaufman (David Carradine), Dempsey is wary of everyone else --  especially his new love (Victoria Sanches). Pursued by the CIA, Dempsey sets out to prove his identity and outwit his pursuers.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Chow Yun Fat heads an excellent ensemble cast in this raw, unflinching actioner of an aging Hong Kong mob boss, Ho Chen-Tung, who lives by a code of honor and keeps peace among rival factions. His estranged son reaches out to him just as Tung and his associates are arrested and Han, a Vietnamese refugee that Tung has taken under his wing, must now deal with families, police and chaos on the streets that increases with each passing day.

link.synopsis: Bound by the disorder they have in common, Tourette's syndrome, adolescent musical prodigy Miles (Chris Marquette) and seasoned jazz saxophonist Tyrone (Gregory Hines) teach each other how to deal with their shared condition by playing music together. Yet Tyrone -- who has learned to control and hide his symptoms -- develops an attraction to the boy's mother (Polly Draper), a situation that forces him to confront emotions he's long buried.

link.synopsis: In this sequel to La Clave 7, kingpin Tono Acosta enlists the help of his two most loyal henchmen, El Gitano and El Culiche, to strike back against the DEA operatives who've made him a marked man. The government agents are messing with Acosta's business, not to mention his life, and he won't be a coward. Who will come out on top -- the government's Code 7 spy or the mighty drug lord? Jorge Reynoso stars.

link.synopsis: This documentary based on Dan Brown's best-seller looks into the possibility that Leonardo Da Vinci may have encoded his artwork with hidden messages -- most notably in his two acclaimed works, the enigmatic "Mona Lisa" and the iconic "The Last Supper." Along with other interesting theories, Da Vinci apparently held the belief that there was more to the relationship between Jesus and Mary Magdalene. But are his theories based in truth?

Crucial to staying one step ahead of the enemy, the Navajo code remained unbroken throughout the conflict despite the Nazis' attempts to decipher it.

link.synopsis: While translating the Dead Sea Scrolls, a professor discovers a formula that can prove God's existence and decrypt any known computer code. link.synopsis: Dan Brown's best-selling novel The Da Vinci Code raised many questions about the history and origins of Christianity and the life of Jesus Christ. Controversial topics such as the relationship between Jesus and Mary Magdalene and Roman influence on the New Testament are covered.

link.synopsis: Robert Palmer (Regis Toomey) patiently endures prison, dreaming of when he can return to his family. link.synopsis: A pioneer in DNA research scours the depths of the world's oceans in search of living clues that will help solve some of the planet's most pressing problems. In an attempt to map the genetic code for every microscopic life form in the ocean, Dr. J. Craig Venter heads to Nova Scotia, the Galápagos Islands and Antarctica. Discovering some undocumented species, Venter also explores new ways to address weather patterns, pollution and global warming.

Before you can say "vengeance," the jealous Motown crime lord (portrayed by Ryan Jones) comes gunning for the foolhardy Ray. Bonus material includes behind-the-scenes footage and interviews.
